adjectives.description: chiastic (comparative more chiastic, superlative most chiastic)

examples: In the Aeneid, Vergil uses chiasmus in order to make his poetry smoother and more picturesque. Many lines could be quoted in which a chiastic order of words was necessary to maintain the dactylic hexameter.

entries.meaning: (by extension) Pertaining to the position of two things relative to one another.
examples: A chiastic98 plotting of the passage illustrates beyond doubt that the disciple has to be identified with the Master.
